frontmatter.title: Oracle PL/SQL Case Statement
frontmatter.description: Oracle PL/SQL provides case statement control which is used in decision making. It has similarities with the IF statement control of PL/SQL. In case statement there is a selector, based on the evaluated value of the selector a block of statement will be executed. The selector will be executed only once.

frontmatter.title: Oracle PL/SQL Blocks
frontmatter.description: PL/SQL is a block structured language. Everything written in PL/SQL are divided in logical blocks. Each blocks has three parts declaration sections, executable sections and exception handling sections.

frontmatter.title: Encapsulation (OOP)
frontmatter.description: Encapsulation is the process that binds data and functions which operates on the data under a single entity. It is one of the most important four features of Object Oriented Programming.

frontmatter.title: Inheritance (OOP)
frontmatter.description: Inheritance is the process of acquiring the properties and functionalities of another class. An object is a container that contains properties and methods to operate of these properties.

frontmatter.title: Humane Typography in the Digital Age
frontmatter.description: An Essay on Typography by Eric Gill takes the reader back to the year 1930. The year when a conflict between two worlds came to its term. The machines of the industrial world finally took over the handicrafts.

frontmatter.title: Johannes Gutenberg: The Birth of Movable Type
frontmatter.description: German inventor Johannes Gutenberg developed a method of movable type and used it to create one of the western world’s first major printed books, the “Forty–Two–Line” Bible.
